result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Robert Verbanac was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.
Consecutive to: Waushara County Case No. 21CF203.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 21CF203, 22CF11, 22CF124, 21TR2108 & 21TR2109 Cases called @ 11:30 AM Defendant Anthony Robert Verbanac in court, in custody.  Attorney Wesley J Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein in court for Anthony Robert Verbanac. Attorney Evan Dahl appears telephonically for Anthony Verbanac on case 22CF11. 22CF124 - The Court entertains wavier of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. As to all matters - Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 21CF203: Ct 1- NC. 22CF124: Cts 1 & 2 - NC. 21TR2109 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 21CF203: Ct 2- DRI. 22CF124: Ct 3 - DRI. 22CF11: Cts 1 & 2 - DRI. 21TR2108 - Dismissed outright. Parties waive the preparation of a PSI. Statement by ADA Kottke regarding sentencing. Statement by Atty Blankschein regarding sentencing. Statement by DE. Court orders: 21CF203 - S/W 3 years probation - Conditions: 45 days WC Jail - Huber, GT, sentence to commence forthwith, DE must maintain absolute sobriety, DE is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, DE is prohibited from possessing any drug paraphernalia, DE to comply with any evaluations and follow through as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent,  Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP.   3 day CFTS in the event of revocation. 22CF124: Ct 1- 45 days WC Jail consecutive to jail sentence in 21CF203 - Huber, GT, 8 days CFTS, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP.  Ct 2 - S/W 3 years probation - Conditions: DE must maintain absolute sobriety, DE is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, DE is prohibited from possessing any drug paraphernalia, DE to comply with any evaluations and follow through as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. 21TR2109 - $150 forfeiture plus costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, 6 mo DL revocation, OWI Assessment. Appeal rights given. Atty Dahl to submit a bill for court appointed attorney fees.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:14 PM Defendant Anthony Robert Verbanac appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Wesley J Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Rae appeared by video for Anthony Robert Verbanac. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant is eligible for SPD services. Bond argument by ADA Kottke. Bond argument by Atty Rae. Court orders $3000 Cash Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Initial appearance scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Initial appearance on June 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.
